definitions.definition: an infective agent that typically consists of a nucleic acid molecule in a protein coat, is too small to be seen by light microscopy, and is able to multiply only within the living cells of a host.
an infection or disease caused by a virus.
examples: disease, bug, infection; contagion the child caught a virus
the virus of cruelty that is latent in all human beings

definitions.definition: a piece of code that is capable of copying itself and typically has a detrimental effect, such as corrupting the system or destroying data.
examples: worm, Trojan Horse a computer virus
